item.title: Tom and Jerry
item.dc:creator: boutje777
item.description: Publisher: Spotlight Publications Ltd. Publication Dates: 1973 – 1974 ? Number of Issues Published: 43 (#1 – #43) Color: Color & Black & White Dimensions: Standard British Modern Weekly Paper Stock: Newsprint Binding: Saddle-stitched Publishing Format: Was Ongoing Series This series ended after 43 issues and was then incorporated into the long-running TV Comic. A […]
item.content:encoded:
Publisher: Spotlight Publications Ltd.
Publication Dates: 1973 – 1974 ?
Number of Issues Published: 43 (#1 – #43)
Color: Color & Black & White
Dimensions: Standard British Modern Weekly
Paper Stock: Newsprint
Binding: Saddle-stitched
Publishing Format: Was Ongoing Series

This series ended after 43 issues and was then incorporated into the long-running TV Comic. A message announcing this was printed on page 10 of No 43, published on 03.08.1974.

Information thanks to the Grand Comics Database

item.title: Tit-Bits Science Fiction Comics
item.dc:creator: boutje777
item.description: Publisher: Pearson Publication Dates: 1953 – 1954 Number of Issues Published: 6 (#1 – #6) Color: Black and White Dimensions: Digest-size Paper Stock: ? Binding: ? Publishing Format: Was ongoing Publication Type: magazine Pearson only released 6 issues of Tit-Bits SF in the UK, but they had a planned a seventh, which they cancelled. However, […]
item.content:encoded:
Publisher: Pearson
Publication Dates: 1953 – 1954
Number of Issues Published: 6 (#1 – #6)
Color: Black and White
Dimensions: Digest-size
Paper Stock: ?
Binding: ?
Publishing Format: Was ongoing
Publication Type: magazine

Pearson only released 6 issues of Tit-Bits SF in the UK, but they had a planned a seventh, which they cancelled. However, Ron Turner had already done it, so when Pearson sold the reprint rights to Chateaudun (France), this issue went with it. This 7th issue has NEVER been done in English, and corresponds to # 21 in the Aventures de Demain series.

Information thanks to the Grand Comics Database

============================

1953-1954

============================
